result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pretrial Services Status Report 10-13-22, filed.  rmm

Defendant Joshua L Cannon not in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Joshua L Cannon.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for plea and sentencing.  Defendant's appearance is waived.  Defendant did not have transportation and Atty. Richardson requests another date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Pretrial Services Status Report 9-28-22, filed.  rmm

Defendant Joshua L Cannon in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held via zoom. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua L Cannon in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom. HELD OFF THE RECORD. Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Richardson has received discovery and and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Kenovia T. DOB 04/25/2003
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joshua L Cannon in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Joshua L Cannon in custody.  Nate K. McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua L Cannon appeared by video means with Attorney. On motion of the court, Court ordered count 1 dismissed without prejudice due to lack of probable cause. Case retabbed due to misdemeanor charges. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
